title: Getting started with BHAIBYE
text: BHAIBYE teaching-focused R package interactive Shiny app visualising burden healthcare-associated infections (HAIs), four tidy datasets Germany EU/EEA. can: browse per-HAI totals (bubble / bar), compare Germany vs EU/EEA rates per N people (slider), view 95% uncertainty intervals (UI) relevant. Provenance & disclaimer datasets BHAIBYE simulated teaching. constructed resemble aggregate patterns reported literature, original survey microdata must used real-world inference policy analysis.

title: Getting started with BHAIBYE
text: Bubble (per HAI) Choose Sample (German PPS ECDC PPS (EU/EEA)). German PPS uses published Germany totals. ECDC PPS converts per-100k rates approximate totals using implied Germany-scale population (see implied_pop_de()). X = annual HAIs (cases), Y = attributable deaths; bubble size = DALYs. Hover tooltips show 95% UI cases / deaths / DALYs. Example - Bubble (per HAI): x = HAIs, y = deaths, size = DALYs (95% UI hover). Bar (per HAI) Choose Sample (German PPS ECDC PPS (EU/EEA)). German PPS uses published Germany totals. ECDC PPS converts per-100k rates approximate totals using implied Germany-scale population (see implied_pop_de()). Choose metric (HAIs / Deaths / DALYs). Bars colour-coded HAI type. Vertical error bars = 95% UI. Example - Bar (per HAI type): totals infection type 95% UI. Geo comparison (per N) Compare Germany vs EU/EEA chosen metric rates per N people. Use slider adjust N (e.g., 1,000 … 100,000). app also prints text summary clarifying region higher much (Tie). Example - Germany vs EU/EEA: bar comparison HAI type, scaled per N population. Example - Auto-generated summary showing higher difference. Age pyramid Choose Sample (German PPS ECDC PPS (EU/EEA)). Optionally filter HAI types; pyramid aggregates weighted DALYs across selected infections. Bars show DALYs age group sex, computed simulated microdata (bhai_cases_de / bhai_cases_eu) using population weights (via pyramid_df()). Hover tooltips report DALYs age–sex bin. Small Monte-Carlo differences vs totals expected. Example - Age pyramid: weighted DALYs age group sex (simulated microdata).

title: Getting started with BHAIBYE
text: package produced context academic assignment. datasets package simulated teaching demonstration purposes. person-level microdata (bhai_cases_de, bhai_cases_eu) synthetic draws calibrated approximate published aggregates; totals rates (bhai_summary, bhai_rates) compact representations derived package. official statistics, may differ source study, used clinical policy decisions. Package scaffolding documentation made much easier thanks R packaging ecosystem - particularly usethis, devtools, roxygen2. Interactive exploration built shiny, plotly, ggplot2; data wrangling utilities rely dplyr, tidyr, scales; theming uses bslib. Concepts, data structure, interpretation follow BHAI approach described Zacher et al. (2019) Eurosurveillance:https://www.eurosurveillance.org/content/10.2807/1560-7917.ES.2019.24.46.1900135#html_fulltext Please refer package LICENSE file terms use redistribution. mistakes oversights .

code: head(bhai_cases_de) #> # A tibble: 6 × 8 #>   hai   age_group sex    death   yll     yld    daly weight #>   <chr> <chr>     <chr>  <int> <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 BSI   25-34     Female     0     0 0.151   0.151    105.  #> 2 UTI   65-74     Male       0     0 0.0840  0.0840   100.  #> 3 SSI   80-84     Female     0     0 0.00960 0.00960   99.8 #> 4 UTI   75-79     Male       0     0 0.0397  0.0397   100.  #> 5 UTI   75-79     Male       0     0 0.0819  0.0819   100.  #> 6 SSI   85+       Female     0     0 0.00551 0.00551   99.8 de_totals_from_micro <- bhai_cases_de %>%   group_by(hai) %>%   summarise(     cases = sum(weight),     deaths = sum(weight * death),     dalys = sum(weight * daly),     .groups = "drop"     ) %>%   arrange(hai)  de_totals_from_micro #> # A tibble: 5 × 4 #>   hai     cases deaths  dalys #>   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 BSI    44042.  2838. 93933. #> 2 CDI    27968.   512.  7688. #> 3 HAP   101618.  2768. 63744. #> 4 SSI    86893.  1596. 30139. #> 5 UTI   241371.  5511. 69527.
